meanings.sent1: The unmerciful judge sentenced the criminal to a long prison term.
meanings.sent2: The unmerciful storm destroyed the entire village.
meanings.sent3: The unmerciful teacher gave out homework even on weekends.
meanings.sent4: The unmerciful winter frost killed all the delicate flowers in the garden.
meanings.sent5: The unmerciful dictator showed no kindness to his people.

meanings.definition: Severe or harsh in treatment or judgment
meanings.sent1: The unmerciful punishment for breaking the rules was suspension from school.
meanings.sent2: The unmerciful criticism from the boss made the employee feel demoralized.
meanings.sent3: The unmerciful referee penalized the player for a minor mistake.
meanings.sent4: The unmerciful sun beat down relentlessly on the hikers.
meanings.sent5: The unmerciful traffic jam caused everyone to be late for work.

meanings.definition: Not showing any forgiveness or leniency
meanings.sent1: The unmerciful landlord evicted the tenants without warning.
meanings.sent2: The unmerciful ruler executed anyone who opposed his rule.
meanings.sent3: The unmerciful chef refused to make any changes to the menu.
meanings.sent4: The unmerciful creditor demanded immediate repayment of the loan.
meanings.sent5: The unmerciful judge handed out the maximum sentence to the criminal.
